snippet: Maybe breaking out of prison was the easy part. After that, Richard W. Matt and David Sweat fought cold, hunger, and eventually each other before one was caught and one was killed....
abstract: Interviews with David Sweat, one of two escapees from Clinton Correctional Facility in Dannemora, NY, in June 2015, sheds light on men's travails in unforgiving Adirondack wilderness; Sweat and his conspirator Richard Matt survived by breaking into hunting cabins and stealing food and evaded capture by traversing swamps, monitoring stolen radio for police movements and using black pepper to throw dogs off their scent.
lead_paragraph: Maybe breaking out of prison was the easy part. After that, Richard W. Matt and David Sweat fought cold, hunger, and eventually each other before one was caught and one was killed.

headline.main: Swamps, Marijuana, Moonshine: 2 Prison Escapees’ 3 Weeks on the Run in New York
headline.print_headline: Swamps, Marijuana and Beer:  Two Killers’ 3 Weeks on the Run
